content:
If you'd like to have dinner and enjoy live music after your Ghost Tour, there are several options near the Hilton New Orleans Riverside that are open late. Here are a few recommendations:

1. House of Blues New Orleans: Located just a short walk from your hotel, House of Blues offers a variety of food options and live music performances, including local and national acts. The restaurant and bar typically remain open until midnight, while concerts and events may run later.
2. The Howlin' Wolf: This music venue, located in the Warehouse District, offers live music performances, ranging from blues to rock and beyond. The Howlin' Wolf also features an on-site bar and food from the Howlin' Wolf Den, which serves classic New Orleans cuisine. Check their schedule for performances and hours.
3. Three Muses: Situated in the French Quarter, Three Muses offers a cozy atmosphere with live music, creative cocktails, and a diverse menu. While the kitchen typically closes around 10 PM, the bar and live music often continue until midnight or later.
4. The Carousel Bar & Lounge: Located inside the historic Hotel Monteleone, this unique, rotating bar offers live music, craft cocktails, and a limited food menu. The bar is open until midnight or later, depending on the day of the week.

Please note that the availability of live music, operating hours, and reservation requirements may vary. It is a good idea to call ahead or check the venue's website for the most up-to-date information and schedules.

To accommodate a late dinner, you can adjust your Friday evening itinerary as follows:

8:00 PM: Join the Ghost Tour with your chosen provider
9:30 PM: Wrap up the tour and head to your chosen restaurant or music venue for dinner and live music
11:30 PM - 12:00 AM: Head back to your hotel after enjoying dinner and live music
